de.japi.components

Class Japi2PrintJob

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.japi.components.Japi2PrintJob

  • public class Japi2PrintJob
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is a more sophisticated custom implementation of a Java PrintJob. The problem with plain PrintJobs is that one can't obtain the size of the border and might draw outside of the printable area. This problem is solved by this class: the method getPageDimension() and getGraphics() will return dimenstions or graphics which automagical consider the page border and the user of this class does not need to care about this.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Japi2PrintJob.Page
      Enum to provide standard page sizes.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Japi2PrintJob

        public Japi2PrintJob()
              throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Constructs a new Japi2PrintJob with an DIN A4 sized paper.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - is thrown if the job was cancelled by the user or can't be created due to the fact that the current system does not support printing.

      • Japi2PrintJob

        public Japi2PrintJob(Japi2PrintJob.Page page)
              throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Constructs a new Japi2PrintJob.

        A known bug is the fact, that the border at the bottom is bigger than the other borders.

        Parameters:
        page - the Japi2PrintJob.Page size.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - is thrown if the job was cancelled by the user or can't be created due to the fact that the current system does not support printing.

    • Method Detail

      • getPageDimension

        public java.awt.Dimension getPageDimension()
        Returns the Dimension of the imageable area of the page. The result of this method already takes the page border into account.
        Returns:
        the size of the page.

      • newPage

        public final void newPage()
        Creates a new page on this print job.

      • end

        public boolean end()
        Ends this print job, meaning that the page is going to be printed.
        Returns:
        true if the page was send successfully to the printer and otherwise false.

      • getGraphics

        public java.awt.Graphics getGraphics()
        The Graphics object of this print job. One can draw directly to this graphic without taking the page border into account. Also multiple calls will provide the same Graphics object.
        Returns:
        the graphics, never null.
